title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.36 - 37 | 23-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Mirandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namao Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Jai Vanarottamam
Devi Saraswati Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session, we will be discussing from the 36th verse and the 37th verse of the 15th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
The meaning of this verse is
When the personality of Godhead Lord Krishna left this earthly planet in its self-same form,
from that very day, Kali, who had already partially appeared,
became fully manifest to create inauspicious conditions for those who are endowed
with the power of the Lord.
With a poor fund of knowledge.
So Krishna's departure from this world to his personal abode in his self-same form,
This difference has to be noted.
In the Bhagavad Gita, Krishna says,
Now here, Krishna is departing to his personal abode in the self-same form.
He never changes his spiritual form.
He never changes his spiritual form.
So eternally he is the Lord.
But eternally he is the Lord.
So eternally he is the Lord.
But eternally he has his form.
So this distinction should be understood
And everything spiritual is permanent, eternal, changeless.
So as long as Krishna was present,
So as long as Krishna was present,
So as long as Krishna was present,
Kali could not manifest its actual characteristic of inauspicious conditions.
But when Krishna left this earthly planet,
And the full manifestation means creating inauspicious conditions.
who are endowed with a poor fund of knowledge.
So what is the meaning of this?
Creating inauspicious conditions for those who are endowed with a poor fund of knowledge.
The influence of Kali can be enforced only upon those who are not fully developed in God consciousness.
even the material modes of nature
Krishna says this in the Bhagavad Gita
they are above the three modes
above the influence of the three modes
and above the influence of the three modes
also means above the influence of Kali
one can neutralize the effects of Kali
actually Krishna is our only protector
because Krishna is not a material personality
is a creation of the illusory energy
and are in the clutches of
everyone else is sheltered by Krishna
just after the battle of Kurukshetra
but it could not exert its influence
because of the presence of the Lord
because of the presence of Lord Krishna
left this earthly planet in his own
that's what is said in this verse
and as soon as he left
as were envisioned by Maharaj Yudhishthira
prior to Arjuna's arrival from Dwaraka
on the departure of the Lord from the earth
even for Arjuna could come back with the
actual news of the departure of Krishna
Yudhishthira Maharaj seeing the ill omens
just as when the sun sets
it is out of our sight
Krishna has disappeared from our vision
to understand the influence of the age of Kali
the influence of the age of Kali began manifesting and from authentic scriptures it is learned that
the age of Kali still to run on for 427,000 years. If I were to put it in the form of
lakhs the total duration of Kali is 4,32,000 out of which 5,000 if you deduct what remains
this balance is 4,27,000 years. So, the symptoms of the Kali Yuga as mentioned above namely
avarice, greed, avarice means greed, falsehood, diplomacy, diplomacy means duplicitous behavior,
cheating, nepotism, violence and all such things are already involved in the Kali Yuga.
And no one can imagine what is going to happen gradually with further increase of the influence
of Kali till the day of annihilation. We have already come to know that the influence of
the age of Kali is meant for godless so-called civilized man. They call themselves civilized
but they are not civilized. They are godless. So, therefore they are uncivilized.
God conscious or godly people are always civilized, are always properly behaving,
properly acting, properly situated, have all the good qualities that are to be found in
Yesyasti Bhakti Bhagavati Akinchana Sarvair Gunai Stratra Samasate Suraha.
In fact, demigod means divine nature. So, divine nature means god conscious people,
godly character as defined in the scriptures. This is not somebody's concoction. It is a
definite description in the 16th chapter of the Bhagavad Gita. The first three verses
Yesyasti Bhakti Bhagavati Akinchana Sarvair Gunai Stratra Samasate Suraha.
Yesyasti Bhakti Bhagavati Akinchana Sarvair Gunai Stratra Samasate Suraha.
And you can see each one of them is good quality, good qualification, good behavior.
Those who are under the protection of the Lord have nothing to fear from this horrible
Maharaj Yudhishtira was a great devotee of the Lord and there was no necessity of his
being afraid of the age of knowledge.
Yesyasti Bhakti Bhagavati Akinchana Sarvair Gunai Stratra Samasate Suraha.
Maheraj Yuddhishtira was a great devotee of the Lord and there was no necessity of his being afraid of the age
Kali but he preferred to retire from active household life and prepare himself to go back
home back to God Yudhishthir is a pure devotee so he doesn't have to actually do any preparation
he is always God conscious so but he wants to teach us before death comes one must retire from
active household life or one must retire from material activities even if one is not a
householder even a brahmachari should retire from all material activities and prepare himself to go
back home back to God so Yudhishthir Mahal setting the example for us the Pandavas are eternal
companions of the Lord and therefore they are more interested in the company
of the Lord than anything else the eternal companions of the Lord always accompany the
Lord in his mission in the material world that's the meaning of eternal companions in this context
besides that being an ideal king Maharaj Yudhishtira wanted to retire just to set an
example for others as soon as there is some young fellow to look after the family then
after the household affairs one should at once retire from family life to uplift oneself to
spiritual realization one should not rot in the dark well of household life till one is dragged
out by the will of yamaraj so this is a lesson we should take from yudhishthira maharaj's behavior
don't remain in household life till the end of life in the body before that quit household life
and make all preparations for going back home back to got it I'll stop here thank you very much
